page.title: 10TOURISM
page.content: The area around Staindrop is very attractive with many pretty walks in countryside with hedgerows & woods. It is on the fringe of the very popular Teesdale & just off the main tourist route. Nevertheless touists do visit the area particular attractions being Raby Casle, the church and the village itself. The centre of the village was declared a conservation area in 1971. This has led to improvement and conservation in the village. There are examples of late 16th century housing with rubble walls, stone slab roofs and mullioned windows as well as later Georgian houses with colour washed rough-cast stonework ans slate roofs. The fan lights are particulary noteable. There is evidence showing where fairs and weekly markets were held on the green and cobbles are still below the turf in some areas.
